meanings.definition: A loose, brightly colored tunic or shirt worn in West Africa.
meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful dashiki to the cultural festival.
meanings.sent2: The dashiki he bought had intricate patterns and vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: The dashiki danced in the wind as she twirled around.
meanings.sent4: His dashiki was a canvas of colors, like a painting come to life.
meanings.sent5: The dashiki stood out in the crowd, a burst of brightness in a sea of dullness.

meanings.sent1: He had to dashiki across the street before the light turned red.
meanings.sent2: The cat would dashiki around the house when it was excited.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel dashiki up the tree, surprising the birds.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to dashiki by as they enjoyed their day at the park.
meanings.sent5: The ball dashiki out of his hands and rolled down the hill.

meanings.definition: A quick sprint or short race.
meanings.sent1: The kids had a friendly dashiki in the park.
meanings.sent2: She won the dashiki at the school sports day.
meanings.sent3: The dashiki between the siblings ended in laughter.
meanings.sent4: The dashiki to the finish line was filled with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The annual dashiki brought the community together for a day of fun.
